intro: Sarcocephalus, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a genus of flowering plants in the Rubiaceae family. It comprises several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. The plants are shrubs or small trees, characterized by their elliptical, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. The fruit is a fleshy, yellow or orange berry that contains several seeds. These plants are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
